summary.title: Coffee Ordering Web App Threat Model

threats.title: New STRIDE threat
threats.description: Provide a description for this threat
threats.mitigation: Provide remediation for this threat or a reason if status is N/A

threats.title: T-001 Customer Account Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker may impersonate a legitimate user to gain unauthorized access if authentication is weak.

threats.title: T-002 Staff Account Spoofing
threats.description: An attacker may pretend to be a staff member, gaining unauthorized access to manager-only features.

threats.title: T-003 Web Application Server Spoofing
threats.description: A fake or spoofed server may trick the manager into revealing credentials or sensitive information.

threats.title: T-004 Order Data Tampering
threats.description: Attackers may alter order-related data processed by the server, affecting reporting accuracy.

threats.title: T-006 Sales Report Tampering
threats.description: Sales or reporting data may be manipulated by attackers, resulting in inaccurate reports.

threats.title: T-007 Code or Configuration Tampering
threats.description: Server code or configuration files may be altered to modify system behavior or bypass protections.

threats.title: T-008 Fraudulent Order Repudiation
threats.description: A user may deny performing actions if server logs are insufficient or easily altered.

threats.title: T-009 Staff Action Repudiation
threats.description: Staff may deny generating or accessing sales reports if actions are not properly logged.

threats.title: T-010 Customer PII Disclosure
threats.description: Sensitive customer information may be leaked through insecure endpoints or misconfigured server responses.

threats.title: T-011 Staff Credential Disclosure
threats.description: Staff login credentials may be exposed by insecure communication or storage mechanisms.

threats.title: T-012 Application Code or Configuration Disclosure
threats.description: Internal configuration values or code may be revealed through errors or exposed endpoints.

threats.title: T-013 Sales Data Disclosure
threats.description: Sales records may be leaked to unauthorized users due to improper access control.

threats.title: T-014 Web Application Server DoS
threats.description: Attackers may overload the server, preventing staff from accessing reporting and management features.

threats.title: T-016 Customer-to-Staff Privilege Escalation
threats.description: A lower-privileged customer may exploit authorization flaws to gain staff-level access.

threats.title: T-017 Staff-to-Admin Privilege Escalation
threats.description: A staff member may elevate permissions to administrator due to weak access controls.

threats.title: T-018 Horizontal Privilege Escalation
threats.description: Users with the same role may access or modify each other’s data due to missing authorization checks.

threats.title: T-004 Order Data Tampering
threats.description: Attackers may alter stored order data, impacting sales analytics and reporting.

threats.title: T-006 Sales Report Tampering
threats.description: Sales-related database entries may be altered, causing inaccurate report output.

threats.title: T-008 Fraudulent Order Repudiation
threats.description: Database logs may be insufficient, allowing users to deny actions or changes made.

threats.title: T-009 Staff Action Repudiation
threats.description: Staff may deny modifying or accessing data if the database lacks proper auditing.

threats.title: T-010 Customer PII Disclosure
threats.description: Customer personal information in the database may be leaked due to poor access control.

threats.title: T-011 Staff Credential Disclosure
threats.description: Staff authentication data stored in the database may be accessed improperly.

threats.title: T-013 Sales Data Disclosure
threats.description: Sensitive sales records may be exposed if database permissions are misconfigured.

threats.title: T-015 MongoDB Database DoS
threats.description: High-load queries or malicious input may overwhelm the database and block report generation.
